page.title: 04LANDSCAPE
page.content: The area is mainly rural, consisting in the main of farmland. There is however an area of coniferous woodland known as Bevercotes Park in the centre of the grid. The lowest point is less than 30 metres above sea level with highest point being over 100 metres. To the east of the B6387 half a mile north of Walesby there is a wooded area called Haughton Decoy, this is one of the largest remaining decoys in England. On top of the hill that separates the two main roads running through the area there is a television communication repeater station, this is a metal structure .
